headline: World's Best Potato Salad
description: The best-ever potato salad is made with potatoes, eggs, and celery in a cooked dressing that's tangy, creamy, and the secret to this delicious side.

video.description: Watch how to make this creamy potato salad.
video.name: World’s Best Potato Salad

name: World's Best Potato Salad

recipeInstructions.text: Place potatoes in a large pot and cover with salted water; bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until tender, about 20 minutes. Drain and set aside to cool.

While the potatoes are cooking, whisk together sugar, 2 beaten eggs, and cornstarch in a saucepan; season with salt. Stir in milk, vinegar, and mustard. Cook and stir over medium heat until thickened, about 10 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in butter. Refrigerate until cool, then stir in mayonnaise.
Peel and dice potatoes. Transfer to a large bowl; toss with hard-cooked eggs, onion, celery, and 1 teaspoon salt.
Stir dressing gently into the bowl of potato salad until evenly coated. Chill before serving, 3 hours to overnight.

review.reviewBody: I have made this several times and it always came out to much dressing, this time I read some of the reviews and took some suggestions like use 2 teaspoons of corn starch. And I added bacon. Finally came out fantastic. My daughter especially loved it. One thing I learned, read some reviews before making dishes. Especially if your amateur cook. LoL

I have been making this recipe for a year at least. It has the best sauce ever. It's great on potato salad, macaroni salad, pasta salad etc. What I like most about it is that the sauce does not absorb all into the salad making it dry. It stays nice and creamy. Thank you for your recipe!

It is the best! I am not a huge fan of potato salad but this one has just the right ingredients. I add 1 teaspoon of celery seed, use Red Potatoes, less sugar and 2 teaspoons of cornstarch. We love onion, so a combo of white and green goes very well in this recipe.
By far, the best Potato Salad I ever made. and like she said, highly requested! I also added diced bacon on top.
I love the dressing, I even used it in making a coleslaw and it's THE BEST!

My wife is known for her potato salad, after making this recipe, I’m giving her some stiff competition. I loved the crunch the celery added. I did add a few pickled banana peppers I needed to use up. Otherwise it was as written. I will definitely make this again
It's my husband's favorite potato salad. Been making it for years. I do add black olives.
Best potato salad ever!

I am very disappointed in this recipe. I made it yesterday, followed it to the letter, and today it tastes exactly like a store bought deli potato salad. It's too sweet, and the potatoes sucked up all that sugar. Four of us tasted it and we all said has a gross aftertaste. I made it for my son's birthday party barbecue today and am in the process of making macaroni salad at the last minute because I don't even want to serve it.
This came out good but I would hold off on the sugar the next time I make it. The taste is good, like egg salad but with potato’s!
OMG...this is my mother’s recipe she used and everyone raves. One time me she had no vinegar and used sweet pickle juice instead! The bomb! We’ve used it ever since.

Awesome! I add at least 4 more potatoes than called for; otherwise it has too much dressing. I like tasting the potatoes. Also, I rarely ever have evaporated milk, so I use regular milk and it works fine. Yum!
Yummy yumm. I made a large batch for 12 servings but didn’t use as many eggs as it suggested for the larger batch (8 instead of 12) and it was creamy and delicious. Rave reviews from everyone.

Excellent creamy potato salad! I did cut the sugar down to one third cup, and used minced shallots. I also used half white vinegar, half apple cider vinegar. A nice sprinkling of paprika on top made it perfect.
my family loved it and anyone who has tried it raves about it and asks for the recipe! this will be my 23rd AR recipe i have tried tested and triumphed!!!

I stumbled a little on the sweetness because i was raised on dill relish. BUT once I got beyond that it is a very good potato salad and I will do this one again. I chopped 3 scallions instead of an onion.
Fantastic recipe. Best I have tasted. If you like potato salad must try
It was good, my wife commented on the taste of the Mustard. The kids ate two helpings and we finished all in two sittings. I will make it again.

Our family of 7 devoured this. We had leftovers and scarfed those on day two! I wonder if some of the people who don't care for this recipe are confusing sweetened condensed for evaporated milk? Cannot fathom. Though it is a little sweeter than some other styles of potato salad. Added paprika for depth, and garden fresh chives. Planning to make a double batch next time!
Delicious! My family loves this and it's pretty easy to make!

This is my go to base. Even though I tweak it, it's an easy five stars. 

I add some chopped green onions and bacon. Eliminate the hard boiled eggs. Cut the sugar to two tbs, add another tsp of corn starch. And I'm not sure if it makes a difference, but I put a tbs of the bacon grease into the dressing.
A friend, who is a great cook, said it was the best potato salad she has tasted. Yeah to the creator of this recipe.

So easy, however, it has a few steps. The flavor of the vinegar, onions, and celery is so clean. The potato and egg just finish off the flavor burst. This is so good the next day and the next. I boiled the potatoes whole for 20 minutes and they came out great. I tried to get the same size. They peeled easy when warm. I used the yukon gold and they held together well. I cooked the eggs 5 minutes in a pressure pot. Peel them warm, and no problem with the shell. ( My daughter's tip) My husband doesn't like the potato salad, so I eat it all! Good luck!
I didn’t make any changes. I will make it again.
Definitely needed more potato.... (not a good judge of size). So a little soupy. Would use a little less vinegar next time. But looks and tastes good! Will make this again!
It was delicious and tasted like I was hoping for and expecting...the best, traditional, mustard style potato salad that I've ever had. Thank you for the recipe!

Wow... To die for potato salad... I reduced sugar to 1/3 cup and increases cornstarch to 2 Tb... I absolutely love this... My new potato salad for all occasions... Thanks for sharing this recipe....For those who haven’t tried it..... Try it!

Love, love, love this. I was looking for a recipe just like this. Yum! I cut down on the sugar a little, added more corn starch and 2 extra eggs. Love it eggy. It lasted longer in the fridge than my other recipes. Others get watery. And it does not smell weird
WAY TOO SWEET! I will not make it again.
This is a family favorite that I make often. I trade diced celery for celery seed's. I also add black olives
I will NEVER make this again. It’s very bland.

I made no changes to the recipe, no changes necessary. This will be my go-to recipe when we want potato salad. I would recommend serving it the next day so the onion flavor isn't too strong. We ate it a few hours after making it but enjoyed it more the next day.
It was soooo good. Loved it!
This is a great recipe. If you don't like the measurements outlined, then find another recipe. This is wonderful as is! Always get wonderful results when I make it. A crowd pleaser for sure!

If you cook the dressing for 10 minutes like the video suggests it becomes quite thick...at least mine did and I used the exact measurements called for on the sauce. While cooking, the sauce had an odd texture which made me a bit nervous but once it cooled and was added to the mayo it was very smooth and creamy. I used 7 medium sized red potatoes but maybe could have added another 1 or 2 and still had plenty of sauce. The only changes I made was to use 1/2 yellow and 1/2 dijon mustard and to sub some green onions for regular onion. It is a bit on the sweet side and I think next time I will use white vinegar. I only had AC vinegar and the recipe didnt specify so...I think white vinegar would make the sauce less sweet. this is a delicious recipe and it will be my new "go to" for potato salad.
Best ever!!!!!
For me, this was too creamy. The potatoes and boiled eggs were drowning in the dressing. Although the flavor was fine, it has a tanginess, there was just too much dressing for my taste.

My husband is a potato salad officianato. He is so particular about his potato salad. I rarely make potato salad because I would have to make it all the time for him. He eats it every day and I just don't have the time. He had trouble finding a potato salad that he liked after our local supermarket deli stopped making the sliced potato salad, so I found this recipe and made it. He LOVES it and I have made it a number of times. I didn't change anything in the recipe. It is perfect like it is. It really ranks among the best potato salads I have ever eaten. 5 Stars does it justice!
Excellent potato salad! Great flavor and I got a lot of compliments from everyone trying it.
I’m beyond impressed with how this turned out! Super creamy but not hyper mayonnaisey.

This was really good! Next time I will cut back on the sugar a bit but only because I like to add sweet pickles to my potato salad and it made it a bit too sweet. 
I have leftover dressing and going to make an apple salad out of it. Thanks for a great recipe!
I loved it. the best. added bacon bits.

Thought this was pretty good. Three changes for me were the addition of a tsp of celery seed, sprinkling the warm potatoes with rice vinegar before adding the dressing, and most important, making the dressing the night before. Big change in flavor the next day.

Impressive old fashioned potato salad recipe. Love the flavor and creamy rich texture. Very happy to have found this recipe. Personally, do not understand any of the poor reviews, at all!!! This recipe, as written, or with the suggested changes, additions, and/or alterations is excellent. It is very forgiving and easy to adjust according to taste. The secret is in the homemade dressing. Thanks for sharing!

It is sweet to the taste. Next time I make it I would add only 1/3 cup sugar instead of the 1/2 cup recommended in the recipe. Otherwise, it is very delicious, never made this type of sauce for a potato salad. Very easy to make.

Think I can make this worlds best for our family. WAY too sweet.
Has great possibility.

This was pretty awful. The cloying sweetness was overwhelming, and the cooked sauce made consistency mushy and too rich. Going back to my traditional recipe with mayo, chopped pickles, onions, vinegar, etc.

I am searching for a perfect recipe for potato salad to make for the 4th. Sadly, this isn't it. This is a good basic potato salad recipe but not a WOW. I want people to beg for the recipe, I would not ask for this recipe. I doubled the corn starch, and cut the sugar back to 1/3 cup, glad that I did both of those things. I really would have loved to add the celery seed, I think that would do a lot for this, but I didn't have any. This isn't bad by any means but just not insanely delicious.

Delicious! The one thing I didn't do correctly was to slightly cook the egg before mixing in the sugar. Also, unnecessarily doubled the recipe so I had plenty left over. Otherwise it was a big hit at the company picnic.
This was soooo yummy!! I made it for my son's potluck and it was a hit! Will be my go to recipe for potato salad
My family seemed to like this but it's way too sweet for me.
This potato salad is delicious and I highly recommended it. I will definitely be making it again throughout the summer months. Thank you so much.

I never get that’s good Mom, using this recipe I got so many compliments! Even as the kids were going out the door with left overs in the hand I was told to,”save this recipe mom!” 
One child hates potato salad and she ate 2 spoonful of it! 
This will be made again an again, thank you for a delicious recipe!
Good tasting potato salad
Very good!! Needs more hard boiled eggs, but that’s more of a personal preference vs. a knock in the recipe. Made exactly as stated in recipe and it turned out perfectly, great flavor!!
My wife doesn’t like celery so I substituted water chestnuts to provide some crunch.
My entire family loved this one and they all have very different tastes in foods.

Love this recipe! I did not change a single thing. Always get compliments when serving this and many will say “this tastes like potato salad my grandmother used to make” . This is very rich and creamy. The cooked dressing makes all the difference.

I don't make potato salad. Never had a recipe that I liked. Always came out bland. This recipe is fantastic. Only thing I changed is I cut the sugar in half because I don't like sweet. This is a keeper!

I've been making the potato salad from this recipe for a few years now and it has become a staple at my friends and families' picnics. I have some friends who would eat this as their main dish if they could.

Some changes I make to the recipe:
I don't include celery or celery salt. I am not a celery fan
I add extra corn starch to thicken the sauce
I add parsley to help garnish the dish
For my MD friends, I add Old Bay
I made this Keto simply substituting cauliflower for potatoes, swerve for sugar and heavy whipping cream for condensed milk. Delicious!

When I tell you that every single time I have made this (several times over the past 3 years) I get rave reviews, I am totally not exaggerating!!!! People go insane over this potato salad!!!! I have always made it exactly per the recipe and it just gets better and better!!! I have made it just for the family at home for a weeknight dinner and have also made it to feed 50+ people at a party and I have never had any leftovers. That’s a great sign that it is a hit!!!!! Thank you for sharing this recipe!!!!

Tastes good but I did a few things differently. I used green onions instead of white, added some pickle juice instead of vinegar and used flour instead of cornstarch. Can’t wait til try it tomorrow after it sits in fridge overnight.
Simply the best!!!!
It was very good
10 stars! This is hands down THE best potato salad recipe I have come across. It has the perfect salty (vinegar) to sweet(sugar) ratio. I cant say good about it. I couldn't stop eating it!!
Cut the vinegar in half. That was plenty for us. We will definitely use this recipe again.
Loved it!!!! I followed the recipe and added some shrimp on it. Bf loved it and will be cooking it again tomorrow. Thanks for sharing this recipe.

A hit with family . Hubby said it was best potato salad he ever ate. Everyone complimented me on it and there were no leftovers. Only change I made was used skim milk as all I had available.
Will make again.

Followed recipe to a t, everyone. Enjoyed it

Made it for a wedding reception, everyone went wild over it.

I mase this exactly as the recipe reads and it was FANTASTIC. No question the best potato salad I have ever eaten. The dressing was just sweet enough and creamy, that’s where it’s at is in the dressing. I made it to take to a dinner with friends and everyone loved it. This is now my only potato salad recipe.

I made no changes other than reducing the sugar. The recipe is perfect as is in every other capacity. Family LOVED it!! I am just now making it again so it can chill overnight and present its perfect self at our Labor Day gathering tomorrow. Simply awesome and worth every minute that goes into it. Thanks, Kaye Lynn!!

I also put some green onions and z little more of my prepared mustard 
I would definitely make it again
Very good
Thicker.. add more corn starch
Excellent. I followed recommendations to decrease sugar to 1/3 cup, increase cornstarch to 2 tsp. and added 1 tsp of Celery Seed. Also substituted the onion with one bunch of green onions. Delicious!

I loved this potato salad! I followed the suggestions of others and increased the corn starch and decreased the sugar. I used apple cider vinegar, almond milk instead of evaporated, half a medium white onion and 3 diced green onions. I left the skin on my red potatoes. I had never hard boiled eggs this way and noticed I could remove the shell easier after they cooled completely. I also added the celery seed. Something to keep in mind is the size of your potatoes for those who had too much dressing. I used larger red potatoes. I also added in another cup of celery. Nothing but rave reviews!
I have made this 2 times now and everyone has just loved it !!! Making it again for a camping trip this weekend.
This is a great recipe! Didn’t change a thing other than quartering the potatoes before boiling because I was short on time. This will definitely be in our menu rotation.
So good very easy I was looking for a cooked dressing like my Grandma used to make this is close.I used apple cider vinegar.

I am not sure that adding some ingredients to mayonnaise (doesn't everyone do that when they make potato salad?) counts as making your "own dressing" as the recipe claims, but I do know that it took a lot more time than the other potato salad I was making and had a slightly less desirable texture in the end. I didn't find it particularly rich or creamy.
This is really the best potato salad that I've ever made. My friend love it. Thank u for sharing
I have made this several times and my family loves it. We decided to change up the recipe and use macaroni. Now I have two favorite summer time salads!!!

Yes l will make this again. Excellent!!
I have made this recipe twice in the past week for get togethers. I was skeptical at first, but everyone RAVED about it! It will now be a staple for every event.

Thanks for sharing this recipe and thanks for the reviews. Good looking out everyone.

Will make it again and again and again! I work for the x military & present.
I made this x3 and they still wanted more!
Delicious ??
Perfect! Made exactly according to recipe. Thank you for sharing your recipe:)
Loved it......Butter sauce makes it...I like my potato salad a little drier...I added the sauce and mayonnaise to the consistency that I like
I think I would have reduced the sugar. It was too sweet for my taste. I also added black pepper to enhance the taste.
This recipe took me back to my childhood visiting my Grandparents on the farm. My family loves and graves this one at every cook out and some specially request I make it !

Made this 3-1-18 Everyone loved it. Went exactly by instructions but used 2 Tablespoons of corn starch.. We are a potato salad family and I make the best. But this was awsome.
Just use sauce according to size of your potatoes I had about 12 medium reds and it was perfect amount. We don't have strange taste for strange foods but this was good and different from plain potato salad...I will fix it again. It takes a little more time but worth it.

I love this recipe. I had never made potato salad and stumbled across this recipe. I nervously made it for a group of friends(picky eaters) and they raved about it. Now i get requests. I did double the cornstarch and a little less sugar.
